column5: Its been a while in between posts - changed jobs a few weeks ago and was without a computer up until yesterday Its another Tales from post - this time I had the pleasure of chatting with Mike DeGrace or "Fishquest" on this site Over the years I have really enjoyed reading Mikes reports and he has been gracious enough to share lots of info. Was a real treat to chat with Mike and his experience doing fly ins from Temgami to Nakinahttps://www.northernjacks.com/post/tales-from-temagami Cheers Andrew

Andrew, great job and very good to meet you and your crew, Mike This post has me licking my chops at the prospect of actually fulfilling our scheduled trips in August (My favorite, Wine Lake Camp) and September (a new experience at Wildewood on Savant Lake). I sure hope the politicians make the opening of the border to us from the US a reality. Thanks to Andrew for helping us dream until it happens. Love the Tales series! Hooks
Thanks Hooks! Glad you enjoyed it It's been a blast writing these and another big plusâ¦ more camps getting on my groups radar for future trips! Andrew
Another good one....thank you! I've only ever done "day" fly outs and would like to do the whole package some day. Maybe after PJ buys the camp I can retire to some remote cabin....
I got information from your article which you have shared here.taming io
Another fantastic article Andrew. Every one of these shows the passion we all share!! Cheers
Rustle up a contract for review. One contingency that has to be in the contract is that I get to rename the lodge.... PjShorthorn
How about "Irish Flamingos in Yoga Pants" ?

Hooks, I definitely think you put some very deep thought into a new lodge name, some of which may or may not be pertinent, but as written I would say that is a hard no. Now as far as Yoga Pants, Gord may donate some of his YPs whereby they could be flown from the top of the fish cleaning house so everyone knows what the wind direction is every morning before loading up their boat. PjShorthorn
